text:
On the Ant online manual, there is a typo in one of the regexmapper examples.
The from tag reads from="a(*.)java" but should read "a(.*)java"


Online link: http://ant.apache.org/manual/CoreTypes/mapper.html#regexp-mapper

Line reads: <regexpmapper from="a(*.)java" to="\1.java.bak" casesensitive="no"/>

Should read: <regexpmapper from="a(.*)java" to="\1.java.bak" casesensitive="no"/>
creator: happyg@happyg.us
jan@materne.de
text:
confirmed.

It is the first <pathconvert>-example. The other are ok.
In the sourcecode it´s on line 500.

creator: happyg@happyg.us
text:
Actually, I just noticed the regex should be fixed to from="a(.*)\.java"

Otherwise it will capture an extra period.

Line should read: <regexpmapper from="a(.*)\.java" to="\1.java.bak"
casesensitive="no"/>

fixed in CVS.

Checking in docs/manual/CoreTypes/mapper.html;
/home/cvs/ant/docs/manual/CoreTypes/mapper.html,v  <--  mapper.html
new revision: 1.29; previous revision: 1.28
done
creator: bodewig@apache.org
